example_sentence_english: I need to slow down.
I am slowing down.
He slowed down the car.
The car slowed down.
The vehicles have slowed down.
The wheels are slowed down.
I slow down when I see traffic.
You slow down too early.

translation_english: he slows down/she slows down/you (formal) slow down
example_sentence_english: He slows down at the turn.
Slow down!
We slow down when it rains.
You slow down before intersections.
They slow down because of the fog.
I was often slowing down there.
You were slowing down before the hill.

translation_english: he was slowing down/she was slowing down/you (formal) were slowing down
example_sentence_english: She was always slowing down there.
We were slowing down when it rained.
You were slowing down too late.
They were slowing down in front of the school.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'rallentato'
example_sentence_english: I have slowed down before the traffic light.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'rallentato'
example_sentence_english: You have slowed down slowly.

translation_english: he has slowed down/she has slowed down/you (formal) have slowed down
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'
example_sentence_english: He has slowed down at the end.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'rallentato'
example_sentence_english: We have slowed down in time.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'rallentato'
example_sentence_english: You have slowed down too late.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'rallentato'
example_sentence_english: They have slowed down for the turn.
